title: How to Enlarge a Square Grid Sewing Pattern from a Book

steps.headline: Look for the scale given by the instructions and create a grid that reflects this proper size that the pattern should be.
steps.description: A common scale is 1" x 1" / 2.5 centimeter (1.0 in) x 2.5 centimeter (1.0 in) per square but each pattern will vary, so be sure to check when making your grid.

steps.headline: Place a piece of tracing paper over the grid.
steps.description: It is best if you tape it into place or it can shift on you as you are tracing over it.

steps.headline: Begin tracing at a point where the pattern line coincides with an intersection of four squares.
steps.description: Make a dot at this point.

steps.headline: Work around the pattern piece carefully.
steps.description: Make a dot at each point where the pattern line intersects with a line on the grid.

steps.headline: Once finished tracing around the pattern, join up the dots.
steps.description: Use the eraser to remove wobbly lines or mistakes.

steps.headline: Draw on any symbols and markings to the pattern piece.
steps.description: This is important so that you know what needs to be done for each piece.

steps.headline: Label and cut out each pattern piece.
Tape together any adjoining pattern pieces that have crossed over pages.
Keep pattern pieces in a labelled envelope so that you don't lose them.

text: Look for the scale given by the instructions and create a grid that reflects this proper size that the pattern should be. A common scale is 1" x 1" / 2.5 centimeter (1.0 in) x 2.5 centimeter (1.0 in) per square but each pattern will vary, so be sure to check when making your grid. Place a piece of tracing paper over the grid. It is best if you tape it into place or it can shift on you as you are tracing over it. Begin tracing at a point where the pattern line coincides with an intersection of four squares. Make a dot at this point. Work around the pattern piece carefully. Make a dot at each point where the pattern line intersects with a line on the grid. Once finished tracing around the pattern, join up the dots. Use the eraser to remove wobbly lines or mistakes. Draw on any symbols and markings to the pattern piece. This is important so that you know what needs to be done for each piece. Label and cut out each pattern piece.  Tape together any adjoining pattern pieces that have crossed over pages.  Keep pattern pieces in a labelled envelope so that you don't lose them.  Proceed with your project!
